channel.title: Compiler.bat help!
channel.description:
Ok, first off i'm using PIMPSCAPE as a source, and im trying to get the compiler to work. I have downloaded JDK 6 and edited the compiler and runserver.bat files based on what the ULTIMATE PRIVATE SERVER GUIDE said. I get the message Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API Note: recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue . . .
I have heard that this isn't an error, but none of the changes that I made to the .Java NPC files don't show up. Help please!
GOD- first post, wrong section of forums. Can someone please move this to the help forum? thank you.

item.title: Compiler.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Nate Mod Nate
item.description:
@Mod_Nate wrote:

Yes,

Be sure to save your files then compile, then runserver.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

All I did was edit NPC’s text >.<. That’s really easy.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 07, 2007, 08:57:13 PM[/size][hr]Can anyone please help diagnose my problem, I can’t seem to get it to work.

I have JDK 6.1 and my compiler file says:

@echo off
title Compiler
“%ProgramFiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

That is correct, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @smartdude6 smartdude6
item.description:
@smartdude6 wrote:

ok ya wrong section and ya those arent errors but maybe you arent makeing the right updates? Make something easy like a tele command to test it out

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’ve moved this to the Server Dev/Help section. Be sure to ask all questions in either this section or the Moparscape Help section in future. If you’re in doubt as to whether you’re posting something in the correct section, just read the stickied topics.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler.bat help!
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

I realize, thanks.

And yes, my files do not update, so doesnt that make it an error? you overreacted a bit there. You were a noob once too :s.

Read the whole thing bastard, my compiler doesnt work correctly.

And thanks lothy, I wasn’t in doubt though, just clicked the wrong one.

Read full topic
